messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Chloe has two pet rats. Their names are Zena and Roxy.
Chloe knows they are not normal pets. She tried many times to tell people. She said rats are not dirty. She said they are good pets. You must look after them well.
But she knows why people feel bad about rats. Chloe did not like rats before. Her friend Martin had pet rats. He showed them to Chloe. Chloe saw they were friendly. She saw they were clever.
Last year, Martin's rat had babies. Chloe wanted two of the babies.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS: All diagnostic checks passed with full compliance. The text successfully maintains factual integrity, meaning, and fidelity to the original while adhering strictly to CEFR A2 linguistic standards. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. Vocabulary is appropriate, using only A1 and A2 words. Sentence structures are simple and direct, avoiding complex clauses, which is excellent for the A2 level. The use of connectors is limited to basic forms, as required. This is a well-executed simplification.
